Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be Better”
Reviews.Author: Deborah D
Reviews.Content: In February, 2012 we spent 8 nights at a two bedroom/two bath condo. The condo was just like the photos on their website. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms allowed the four of us to spread out. The maid service was an unexpected service and was perfect. The property is beautifully lanscaped and in an ideal location. The Indigo Beach club was one block away, Fifth Avenue was around the corner and the grocery store was in walking distance. We loved Playa del Carmen. The food was terrific, the people very friendly and the weather and beach perfect. No one should be concerned about safety when traveling to this area of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Churant
Reviews.Content: Maya Villa is a beautiful property tucked away less than a block off of 5th Ave in Playa Del Carmen. Everything from the room to the service at the gym, beach club and hotel were top notch. The rooms: Our room was a 2 bed/2 bath condo with fully equipped kitchen, living and dining area. It was immaculately clean and I am a clean freak. We had a huge cooler of purified water for drinking and cooking which came in so handy because we were constantly refilling our water bottles. Indigo beach club: From what I could tell this was the best beach club on the strip. The service was impeccable and the beach was gorgeous. We had a complimentary breakfast on the beach every morning which included anything from eggs to french toast, fresh fruit, coffee, fresh fruit juice, pastries etc. The food was ok, but this is what we found at most places on Playa. Not bad by any means. Just your typical caribbean island food. Gym: We used the gym 5 out of our 6 days there. They had an extensive class list anything from cycling to boxing and yoga. It was clean, convenient (1/2 a block away) and perfect for a quick workout. It was one of the more extensive gyms I've had access to at a resort/hotel. Beach: The beach was lovely, though, here is where you will see my only complaint. The boats really detract from its beauty and track debris into the water. It's funny because you really don't notice this the first few days. It wasn't until day 5 that I looked around and thought, hmm, these boats are making the water a little dirty. And by dirty I mean bits and pieces of plastic, water bottle labels floating etc. I mean it wasn't bad, but just something to be aware of. Service: The service was great. Everyone was super accommodating and always had a smile on their face. Location: AMAZING! Probably the best feature here. I wanted to get away but also have access to restaurants and clubs so this was great. We didn't have to take taxis anywhere. Everything we wanted was just steps away from the hotel. We tried a lot of different restaurants and bars and had a great time just walking up and down 5th ave. However, we weren't on 5th so our street was quiet and quaint. Overall amazing stay at this hotel and beach club. Couldn't have asked for more on this trip. We would definitely go back and recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: englishguy25
Reviews.Content: Found this place to be below average and had nothing on some of the other places i've stayed in throughout Mexico. Rude staff and too small. Would never return!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings but enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: escholte
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Maya Villa Condo was a mixed bag of emotions for us. Check in was smooth but as we were in villa 417 the hike up and down stairs multiple times of day was a turn-off. Glad we weren't with small kids and strollers - would have been a nightmare. We felt the villa seemed smaller than the photos and ours felt very dark due to the colours of the walls, also you either sit on a patio which is overlooked by all or on a smaller one staring at a blank cement wall a few feet away. The room was otherwise ok - water cooler, fridge, comfy bed and nice bathroom but no bath. The penthouse terrace is also accessed from outside the villa whereas some others have an internal access. This means you either have to lock up while you sit on the terrace or trust that no one has snuck into the complex. Also the rooftop in quite exposed to other penthouse villas and having a skinny dip in the hot tub is a tricky undertaking. Access to the beach club was nice but not being able to use the Taj pool was a disappointment. The part of the beach has boats moored in front of it so have to walk about 5 minutes to a swimmable but shallow area. It would have been nice to have quick dip in a pool after swimming in the sea but this is not possible. They did allow you to use the pool shower but I think they could allow access to any pool irrespective of which part you stay in, the numbers would not be large. The pool at the Maya Villa is very small and never gets any sun, also the last 24+ hours of our stay was closed off for chemical treatment. This meant we had no access to any pool. The villas are also for sale and we were phoned one day to ask if the sales rep could show someone around - luckily we are very tidy but would have been cheesed off if we suddenly had to tidy up for a viewing. Staff were lovely, concierge was helpful, access to out of town beach club - Al Cielo was beautiful. Would I go back? - probably not. Would I consider buying a villa - definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 405 and were fully satisfied. The location and affiliation with Indigo Beach was wonderful. A 90 second pleasant stroll to the beach in the morning....and a 90 second walk to the best part of 5th avenue in the evening. The staff were friendly and very competent. Several things to know...for us breakfast was included at the beach; a surprise. And the IS a common roof top pool in the larger property. The individual units are for the penthouse occupants. If you know Playa you'll be very pleased. I hope to go back and can recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Maya Villa Unit 403”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip down to Mexico, but our first time staying at Maya Villa. We have stayed at all inclusive resorts during previous visits, so vacationing in a condo was something new to us...and we loved it!! Steps from the beach, with service from a welcoming staff just like any other resort, we found ourselves with more privacy and loads of options for food and entertainment. The condo had everything we needed and more..including a dock for our ipod/ipad so we could play our own music, pots/pans, maid service, etc. And the roof top deck (not all units have one) was our favorite part with a private hot tub and views of the ocean. My husband enjoyed many trips to the gym and the concierge services on the lower level of Maya Villa set us up with a great trip snorkeling and zip lining nearby. We can't wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: Kellianne B
Reviews.Content: We didn't even stay in this location but we wanted to do a review because Tania was absolutely sweet and amazing. She provided the BEST customer service experience of our entire stay in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Living the Good Life at Unit 416, Maya Villa”
Reviews.Author: rafab1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful five-day stay at Unit 416 of Maya Villas. This place hits everything on the highest levels: LOCATION: Right on First Avenue, which is directly between the ocean and the famous Fifth Avenue; VIEWS: panoramic ocean views plus views from two balconies directly onto First Avenue, which is great for people-watching; AMBIENCE: luxury appointments throughout the villa. Everything at Unit 416 is pristinely clean and polished with very nice toiletries in each bathroom. Oh, and the pool is so neat: it’s elongated and structured in the shape of a gecko, so it’s private at every turn of the pool, and ends in a waterfall. Nice hot tub annexed to the pool too. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite winter get-away”
Reviews.Author: Pinkrotz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Playa del Carmen a number of times and stayed at several of the condo hotel locations, but Maya Villa is definitely our top choice. We returned for a second year to Maya Villa 403 because we feel we have found the perfect location. We are a block from the complimentary El Taj beach club which was our favorite place to spend relaxing hours soaking up the sun, sipping margaritas, and enjoying the scenery. We were also a block from the complimentary, newly-upgraded gym and from 5th Avenue, the best place for dining and shopping. The spa, which I visited for the first time this year, was private and professional. The condo is well-equipped, comfortable and clean. Best of all is the roof deck and hot tub with a great view of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “"playa del carmen was wonderfully surprising"”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel45963
Reviews.Content: Having been Mexico adverse for decades, an invitation from a friend inspired us to try again with our 2 university student sons, and 8 friends in our party. The accommodation was exactly as pictured, and included everything we needed including DVDs and internet. The concierge in particular was extremely helpful on many occasions from booking our activites, to taking care of some unexpected business activities that arose. Manuel Montalvo was extremely knowledgeable and helpful on all occasions and deserves a call out, thank you Manuel! The Indigo beach club was fabulous and the folks taking care of us on the beach were outstanding from delivering food and libations to responding to the multiple umbrella moving requests from our group. I didn't thnk I would say this, but I would consider going to Playa Del Carmen again!

Reviews.Title: “playa del carmen, my favorite place”
Reviews.Author: mamasita9367
Reviews.Content: loved the condo it was clean and spacious. indigo beach club was nice, they had a great breakfast. staff was very friendly. Only issue, fishing boats are right in front of the beach club. Close to everything you do not need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Bes location in Playa”
Reviews.Author: mwiley1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during Carnival, and found this to be the best location for shopping and for beaching it. Their beach club was not a very good place to hang out for the day, but since it was free we tried it out. The beach itself is on such a slant away from the beach, you are laying uphill and you can't even see the ocean as there is a big drop off to the beach. The water was dirty with trash and kelp, and the small beach is not groomed by staff at all as is some other places we have stayed. The restaurant food at the beach club is at most average and way overpriced, but just across the side road are two small family owned cafes that were better, and much, much cheaper, although not that good either. If you have to eat average food, better to pay less just 30 feet away. As far as the condos and property go, it was the cleanest, well maintain complex or villa we have ever rented, and that is quite a few as we go the the Roo at least 3 times a year for the past 27 or so years. Very impressive. We stayed in 413 penthouse thinking that we would have a great view of the ocean and a big terrace. Pictures can be deceiving! It was very small with barely a view of the ocean...you had to lean over the kitchen counter to see it. Unimpressive...the gas grill igniter is broken so you must light it from underneath which proved to be very dangerous. As soon as my husband went to light it, a hugh fireball blew up in his face and burned his eyebrows and lashes almost off, burning one eyelid. My brother-in-law standing next to him almost burned his shirt. Think twice about cooking out. If you have small children, this is not the place for you. The rails are too far apart and the stairs steep. The have great kid friendly units on the the first floor. Would I stay there again? Yes...but without grillling...

Reviews.Title: “Maya Villa Condo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: The best playa del Carmen offers. Great location, great beach club, best gym. Very roomy, and spacious. Loved the waterfall in the pool. Indulge.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: carsarchi
Reviews.Content: Best vacation. Food at beach club was great. Gym was as good as any gym in the world. Condo was great - beautiful and very clean. Lots of room for family. Very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Maya Villa - simply marvelous”
Reviews.Author: YahHeyDer
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Playa at least 20 times over many years, mostly to all-inclusives. This time we ventured to this Condo Hotel, and loved it. A good daily workout is important to us and the included Health Club access was a fabulous part of this package. Show your Hotel ID and walk in. It is a full service Health Club with 5 spinning classes per day (less on the weekend), Pilates, Yoga, and lots of high quality working equipment. We like to cook and the kitchen was surprisingly well equipped. The condo was clean and quiet. Service was always with a smile. We paid extra for Wi-Fi, connecting 6 devices. There were some issues and a tech guru came by to help within a few minutes. Although most devices ended up working things weren’t perfect so the charge was canceled. Beach club access is also included (3 minute walk). We were there at relatively low season and so there was never an issue with lounge availability. Beach service was very attentive and friendly. They made sure your shade umbrella was always properly positioned and you were not allowed to go thirsty. Local fishing and dive operators tie up there boats in front of this club so you do get an occasional whiff of 2-cycle exhaust, but it makes for built in entertainment … especially when there are trophy fish coming ashore. We are definitely coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprising Find!”
Reviews.Author: DeboraTravels
Reviews.Content: Friends booked this appartment hotel and I was a little sceptical to begin with as I already have my favourites in Playa Del Carmen. It seems on the web site that the property is on the beach, actually it is one block away however the location within PDC is just perfect. The "IN" places are all within a stones throw and the amazing thing is that none of the noise from the lounge bars or clubs filters back to the rooms, its almost like a little oasis. The rooms are large and very clean, I had a 2 bedroom, each bedroom having an ensuite plus a very attractive lounge area. All rooms have TVs and iPOD docking stations, kitchen is well equipped (although never used!) with free water from a cooler. The check in / check out was fast and friendly (not always the case in Mexico!) and very informative. Maya Villa has a relationship with a very good gym a couple of doors away complete with free classes. It was a delight to have free access to such a nice facility. The beach club was the only small let down as day one of our stay was ruined by 4 hours of drilling at the side of the club. Its not really possible to enter the sea directly infront of the beach club as its where boats are moored however a 5/10 minute walk down the beach takes you to better waters.

Reviews.Title: “Time of my life in paradise”
Reviews.Author: renee c
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot over the years and i have finally found a piece of paradise! Attention to details and client satisfaction are priorities here. Everyone makes you feel at home! I will return,

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - just one block from busy 5th avenue with all the shops, restaurants and a great cultural experience; and just one block to sand and beach - very quiet street - excellent staff and the condo itself was just excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Music and Marble”
Reviews.Author: SunshineLove40
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Playa Del Carmen for the BPM Music Festival to celebrate the 2012 New Years. My experience visiting Maya Villa (right in the center of Playa Del Carmen) was quite lovely. The room size were very adequate and comfortable. The space is super clean feel like - brand new, kitchen, bathroom, furniture, etc. The location is bang on perfect and walking distance to all activities (beach, resto, club, etc). It also has a nice and fancy roof top with an amazing view - you feel like on top of the world in the tropics if you plan to do BBQ or just having a few drinks or not :) In a nut shell, I fell like I was in a top of the line condo and not an hotel room. So it was like a home away from home. You will enjoy your experience at Maya Villa and strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: We had a penthouse that overlooked the water with a large rooftop patio, bbq, hot tub, and dining area on top. Excellent for entertaining, laying in the sun, relaxing...you name it! Great location in downtown Playa del Carmen. Service was very friendly. Amazing gym included that's right next door. Would highly recommend and definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “A Las Vegas experience in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: kidmyn
Reviews.Content: When I first saw pictures of this property I was stunned, but when I saw this place in person I was inlove. Such a spacious and warm place, our living room was an open concept that had a kitchen with top of the line equipment (Bosch). We had flat screen t.vs in all our rooms and we had fans and a/c in each room. Outside our room there is a little seating area which was beautiful and relaxing because of the beautiful sounding waterfall coming from the downstairs pool. We had a few menu's to pick from when we were hungry and the service was amazing, the food was delicious, affordable and filling!! The staff members were really nice including the cleaning staff. We rented this villa for the BPM Festival and it was the PERFECT location. It was a 5 - 8 minute walk to Kool Beach and it was a 5-8 minute walk to all the clubs. You are literally in the center of it all! I suggest anyone who is going to any future BPM parties to book at the Maya Villa and just save yourself a headache and know there will be no surprises instore! I will definitely be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE FOR A VACATION AND BPM FESTIVAL”
Reviews.Author: MSymes
Reviews.Content: We had heard great things about Maya Villa and the year prior to this took a look at it. This year we rented the 2 bedroom penthouse. What a perfect view we had of the ocean and exclusive luxury that we wanted. The value was absolutly amazing, the staff all welcoming and thorough. For the events going on at the BPM Festival 5 Year Anniversary we were in the perfect location. Each event easy to access and yet removed enough to escape for a breather. We heard about people getting no sleep but great beats but we slept perfectly and the hole building was packed with such interesting and open people from all over the world. Thank you Maya Villa and Condo Hotels for a one of the best years I have had in playa Del Carmen. And the best BPM Festival to date. It was Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Amongst the best yet”
Reviews.Author: gary c
Reviews.Content: I've travelled rthe world and this condo-motle rates amongst the best anywhere. All the privacy you want with all the partying, good restaurants, shopping and beaches wirthin walking distance. it doesn't get better than this. .

Reviews.Title: “Started 2012 at the Maya Villa”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug814
Reviews.Content: The condos are clean and very convenient to the beach and to all the restaurants, shops and Mega! The staff was amazing and helped organize a driver to the ruins, airport and make reservations! I would definitely stay again...perfect for group of friends, singles, couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: r211
Reviews.Content: AMAZING! I have stayed at all of the properties and have not been disappointed with any of them. Everyone has been very friendly and welcoming! Looking forward to going back in March.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kathy r
Reviews.Content: We just returned completely satisfied from a long awaited vacation. The accommodations at Maya Villa were perfect and as described. Beautiful clean marble & granite throughout the full size kitchen and bathrooms, nice size bedrooms and very nice outdoor sitting area. A beautiful tropic oasis right in the middle of the village. The beautiful beaches of Playa Del Carmen are only 1 block away. And the famous pedestrian street 5th avenue is only 1 block in the other direction with all the shops, spas and restaurant one could possibly ask for all within walking distance. We did rent a car (which we hardly used) as this was our first time here and didn't know better, so it was great to have private garage parking included. We definitely will be returning and staying at Maya Villa again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views... average customer service/amenities”
Reviews.Author: pamss121
Reviews.Content: My family and in-laws stayed here for 7 nights right before the Christmas holiday. Overall - our experience was okay. We stayed in Room 417, which is often reviewed as one of their better condos. Let me start off by saying that the condo was very nice and the rooftop patio had an INCREDIBLE view of the ocean. It was perfect for sunbathing if you didn't want to walk to the beach (which isn't that far at all, by the way). The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were always cleaned very well. There is always a guard/doorman at the gated entrance to the condos, and all of them were always super friendly. The condos themselves are about a 3-5 minute walk from the beach and all the shopping on 5th avenue - which is one of the main reasons we chose to stay at this property. I can't give this hotel more than an average rating for several reasons. First, there are 12 conditioners stored on the rooftop (hidden by foliage) that make it difficult to sleep in the master bedroom of the condo. The noise from them all running is very annoying and bothered us on many occasions. The grill on the rooftop has something wrong with the right burner. When we turned it on to use it flames shot out of the side. The pool at the condos isn't much to rave about - and the way that the condos are set up, there is absolutely no sun that actually makes it into the pool. The only contact that we had with the staff (besides saying hi to the doormen and occasionally bumping into the maid on our way out/in) was on the second day of our stay. My husband needed to send an email back to the states to let someone know that we had made it safely and we didn't want to pay the $10 per day to use the internet for one email transaction. He explained that we had already made attempts to use a calling card in our room that had failed, and that we didn't want to pay the international charges to make a call. We were told to just use the phone and pay the charges. We were very surprised that the front staff had absolutely no desire to help us with something so simple. I suppose my husband and I have been spoiled by previous stays at bread & breakfasts where the staff will bend over backwards to help you do anything. Honestly, this one interaction (and lack of customer service) was enough to make us never stay here again. Thankfully, we found free internet access just a few blocks down at a coffee shop (Ah Cacao).

Reviews.Title: “Simply Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Lara S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our great vacation to Playa del Carmen. I call it great because if it wasn't for the accommodations at Maya Villa, it probably would have been just another vacation. Everything about this establishment was so professional; the attention to detail, the cleanliness, the inviting warmth of the staff as well as the amenities which include access to Indigo Beach club, the Gym and the Maya Spa. The rooms themselves are luxurious but not pretentious, quiet and distanced from your neighbors so everyone has their space. As well the grounds are just picture perfect. We can't wait for our return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Condo's-Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: cindy1660
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. We had never been to Playa and really didn't know what to expect. This property couldn't be in a better place. We took a taxi from the airport (negotiated a rate of $25 plus a stop at a store for adult beverages) which made finding it the first time super easy. The Indigo Beach Club, which is an amenity of the condo's, is really nice and the people are super friendly. It is a block and a half from the condo's. The main shopping, eating, tourist street, 5th Avenue is also a block and a half away. The actual condo itself is the perfect size for 2 people. I think 4 people would work fine, but it might be a little crowded. There are two bedrooms and two bathrooms. We used the bedroom with twin beds and our closet, dressing room and we each had our own bathroom which I think is the greatest thing ever. If you have a chance to stay at Maya Villa, you will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Pavol P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maya Villa for 9 nights and enjoyed our whole stay. The one BR apartment had a spacious living room, modern kitchen with all appliances, two flat-TVs, large bed, all the equipment is new. We extensively used the jacuzzi located right in front of the apartment. We also used the hotel garage which was perfectly accessible. The hotel is located very close to the beach (one block), to the centre (5th and 10th avenue), to diving shop, etc. but it is still very quiet and one has enough privacy all the time. The breakfast is served right on the beach (at Indigo restaurant of El Taj). We greatly appreciated the concierge service by William who also happily shared with us lots of information about the Mayan culture and local specialties. Overall, the service was at the highest level. Pavol

Reviews.Title: “Mayan Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TCB25
Reviews.Content: Nothing like sipping on a glass of wine and listening to a waterfall! Steps away from the beach and 5th street the wife and I had the best of Playa for much cheaper than El Taj Oceanfront. The 1 bedroom condo was perfect for my wife and I! Wake up head to the beach, lunch at Indigo, massage at Maya Villa, dinner on 5th street and a bottle of wine on the patio listening to music and the waterfall!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Playa!”
Reviews.Author: linukasm
Reviews.Content: Maya Villa is a Mayan dream in Playa del Carmen! So private and surrounded by palm trees and plants, it’s like its own tropical oasis in the middle of bustling streets and 5th Avenue. Our unit was a 2-BDR condo suite on the ground floor, with an outdoor terrace overlooking a gecko mosaic pool and a Jacuzzi. We had a kitchen, two large marble bathrooms, flat screen TVs throughout and expensive linens in both bedrooms. The front desk staff, security and maids were all so helpful and kind to us, and everyone spoke English. I had never imagined what it be like to stay at a condo hotel, and this was one of my best hotel experiences ever. I kept asking myself – why pay the same amount for a small hotel room at a resort somewhere in the jungle, when you can stay in the best downtown area of Playa del Carmen, one block from the beach, and in the middle of all the action, but still have your own sanctuary, like a refuge surrounded by exciting life of this tropical international beach town. I am coming back this winter, so hold my unit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place that won't break your bank”
Reviews.Author: Rodney H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beachside condo over the past weekend. The beauty and luxury are so overwhelming that it's hard to put into words, but I'll do my best. First, the rooms are gorgeous - especially for the modest price. I can honestly say I have never stayed in a place so nice, including private beach houses in Florida. The traditional Mayan art scattered throughout the place were all carved out of a single piece of wood. It seems impossible when you look at the great details. The service is outstanding as well. My room was cleaned by midday, every day. Playa del Carmen is paradise and the condo is located right by everything you need. Bars, restaurants, 5th avenue, Indigo Beach Club. You have to experience these things while you're there. All are within walking distance. I didn't want to leave. Thanks, Maya Villa. You made this vacation one of the most memorable. There is no doubt in my mind that I'll be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Playa del Carmen's Best”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful jewel of a hotel. I knew we would be staying in a condo, but I had no expectation how well appointed it would be. I imagine Heaven will be like this - or at least, I'm hopeful retirement will be. I don't even know where to start. Maya Villa is such a beautiful Hotel. Playa del Carmen is such a beautiful location. We arrived in Play del Carmen with the hotel arranged driver and walked into an oasis. Coming through the gates you could forget you're in a city. The attention to detail in this condo hotel is mind-boggling. Everywhere you turn there are what appear to be hand-carved mayan artifacts. It took me a while to figure it out, but the pool and its surrounding tile are in the shape of a gecko! The rooms themselves are gorgeously appointed. For a family, there's nothing better when on vacation than a functioning kitchen. Don't get me wrong, the restaurants of Playa del Carmen are worth a visit, but after a long day on the beach nothing beats a laid-back dinner at home (really, it feels like home - I'd move in if I could). Speaking of the beach, the beach club is an amazing perk. We were able to go down and camp out all day. And the best part is that the Indigo restaurant offers great food and a wonderful shady break from the heat. The staff at the beach club was just incredible. One of the attendants, Miguel I think, actually brought out a bucket of sand toys for our littlest one to play on the beach. Oh, and Teresa, the concierge was super too. She had tons of great recommendations and even arranged the perfect tour of Tulum with a side-trip to a beach-side restaurant for killer fish tacos. From what I could see you can't go wrong with any of the choices from the folks who run Maya Villa. Our experience was great! And the cost for our 2 bedroom condo was very inexpensive I highly recommend Maya Villa if you're looking for a Playa del Carmen Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation even with a tropical storm”
Reviews.Author: elena s
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked in El Taj oceanfront condo hotel, the sister hotel to Maya Villa. When we arrived several days ago they informed us a hurricane was making it's way to Playa del Carmen. We asked to be moved the day before the hurricane was suppose to arrive since our room was directly in front of the ocean. Luckily the hurricane lost it's strength and turned out to be a major tropical storm. We did spend the first two days at El Taj which is an amazing place but we prefer Maya Villa! The Maya Villa is located on a picturesque street (half a block from El Taj) and it is a very quiet, more like a quaint boutique style hotel. We love this place since you receive all the amenities including the beach club which is only a short block from the beach. Their fitness club is right next door a few feet away. The units are breathtaking and everything has curved walls like all their other properties. Maya Villa has it's own Spa located in the building and it was real handy having it so close since it rained for 3 days. Oh, the concierge her name is Teresa is also located in the building and she is awesome! She knows all the best restaurants and she has a great library of complimentary videos and games. When you enter through the Mayan arch of Maya Villa you feel like you entered a private exclusive villa. Even though the place was fully occupied we felt like the whole place belonged to us. The swimming pool is the most amazing pool we have ever seen. It is shaped like a Gecko Lizard with beautiful jade colored glass mosaic tiles. It is more like a river pool with a big waterfall. They upgraded us to a three bedroom duplex which has an amazing private roof top deck and jacuzzi and outdoor kitchen with the most incredible view of the Caribbean. The appointments are luxurious and all the appliances are brand new. Having a duplex is really nice because for a family like us everyone has their own space and lots of space. The bathrooms are spotless as is the rest of the unit and the entire place. The staff is very helpful and everyone speaks English which was very helpful since we don't speak Spanish. We felt very safe at all times and the security guards are always eager to help us with anything we needed. About the beach club, The beach attendants are really awesome and as soon as they saw us coming they organized our chairs and umbrellas and set us up like we were royalty. When the sun shifted they automatically came and repositioned our umbrellas without even asking. These guys don't miss a thing and they even have this professional sun glass cleaning machine which they ask if you want your glasses cleaned complimentary. The waiters and the food at the beach restaurant are fantastic even though we thought the price on some drinks are a bit steep. Also check the promotions on their web site because we understand they offer complimentary buffet breakfast most of the time. The buffet breakfast is very popular and we ate there everyday. It's a very lavish buffet. We already booked our next vacation at Maya Villa. I hope you find this review helpful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erik S
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Playa for many years to enjoy vacation time with my family. We have stayed at a variety of hotels and some resorts as well. Maya Villa is now our only choice in Playa. It is perfectly located right between 5th Avenue (Pedestrian only) and the most beautiful white sand beach ( a block away ). They have appointed the units which are more like a private resort condo than a hotel with many local artworks and a real sense of unity with the local culture . The service provided the concierge is by far , the best and most friendly in the area. The units are spacious and well laid out . Flat screen TVs ,Wifi and a really cool Gecko shaped swimming pool kept the kids happy in the evenings. They are also kept amazingly clean . I see many familiar faces as I continue to return to Maya Villa , so I must be among some fortunate others to have found this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: jssr319
Reviews.Content: Been to Playa many times,,,this is the nicest hotel you will find....Clean large units..so close to the beach..they set your chairs up for you and umbrellas.The best part of this hotel is the workers,,,pools are spotless they are always cleaning...Location is excellent,5th Av is right there and so is the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Maya Villa #417”
Reviews.Author: veronica796
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Maya Villa and loved the location, which is just 1/2 block to the beach and 1/2 block to 5th Avenue. We staid in the penthouse #417 which was furnished beautifully with carved wooden Mayan art pieces. The rooftop was wonderful! We spent a lost of time up there between sunning on the chaise lounges, napping on the comfortable circular sofa, relaxing in the hot tub and one night we even grilled fresh fish and ad friends join us for a dinner party up there. Our friends were staying at another resort and they were so jealous. The view of the Carribean from the rooftop is spectacular.(we could actually see Cozumel from there) and there was always a cool breeze. Loved it!! . . . . . planning another trip for the spring and we will definitely stay at Maya Villa #417.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Zivile A
Reviews.Content: "“We heard a lot about Maya Villa from our friends, and then we finally decided to check it out ourselves. Entering though the gates is like going to a separate world of tropical plants, pools and fountains, while the bustling streets of Playa del Carmen remain outside. As a group of four people, we got a 2-bedroom condo. And this is the best part. We paid less than a regular hotel would cost, but got the more space than we needed! We had our very own living room, a kitchen, two bedrooms with separate bathrooms and a terrace overlooking the pool and outdoor Jacuzzi. We even hired a private chef to cook our dinners, for about $100 per dinner. We are coming back soon, and we wanted to share our experience with everyone about our new favorite property in Playa del Carmen.” ..

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Maya Villa Condos, perfect location for everything”
Reviews.Author: BKSweetheart
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews and saw all the pictures of this place before I got there, so I had no doubt it was going to be nice. But WOW, this place more than exceeded our expectations! We were in the first floor one bedroom condo 412. At first I wasn't sure about the being on the ground floor thing for noise and safety reasons but you quickly forget all that when you see how nice the place is. It was impeccable - all new, modern appliances, fully stocked, flat screen TVs in the living room and bedroom, iPod alarm clock, the bed was enormous and AMAZING, tons of drawers and closet space, even a closet for your suitcases. On top of that, being on the ground floor, the pool and jacuzzi are literally steps from your front door (and a waterfall!). There were only a few other guests at the place so we basically had both the pool and jacuzzi to ourselves every night. It was looooovely :-) :-) And more on top of that, Maya Villa is in the perfect location for everything. Its tucked away on a quiet block and its only a short block and a half away from 5th ave (the main street thru playa), the beach and to street where all the nightclubs are. Also when you stay at Maya Villa they give you cards for access to the Indigo Beach Club at the El Taj beachfront condos. The Beach Club was pretty sweet as well - the chairs were comfortable, the drinks and food were delicious. (Only downside is, as some others have said, the actual area of the water in front of Indigo has a bunch of fishing/snorkeling boats docked so you cant really swin there with the smell of gasoline. However we just left our stuff at our chairs and walked maybe 50-100 meters down the beach and the water was fine and no one bothered our stuff.) I highly recommend and would definitely stay here again next time in Playa. Its the best of both worlds - you get the privacy and quiet of being somewhere secluded yet all the best (IMO) things in playa are only a short walk away. *There is only one slight negative comment I had and this has nothing to do with the hotel itself. The last two nights were were there, there was a different night security guard. First, he told us we couldn't smoke by the pool because (guessing) he thought we might drop the ashes or butts in the water. Even though others guards saw us smoking there previously and said nothing plus it was evening and there was no one else even in the pool (and hardly any other guests staying at the place for that matter. Also, to clarify, we weren't actually smoking IN the pool, we had our ashtray on the ground next to the pool). Fine, not a big deal, I get it, so we put the cigs/ashtray on our little porch and got back in the water. This guy literally kept lurking the whole evening, passing by over and over again like he thought we were going to try to sneak and do it again. We finally just went inside because he was being such a stalker.The second night, our last night, same thing. It was raining so we couldnt go in the pool, we were just sitting on our little porch chatting and having a couple glasses of wine, this guy kept passing by over and over. Anyways, it was very invasive and annoying. I'm sure it had nothing to do with the hotel because all the other guards were very friendly and helpful, this guy was just clearly a jerk.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo B
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all itens, no matter you looking for fun, beach or peace. The room is perfect, offering everything you need, into gorgeous decorations and excellent service. I intend to come back soon, and I'm indicating to all my relatives and friends. In addition is important to remember that the place where the hotel is located, in my oppinion, is better then Cancun itself, specially when you intend to do a family travel, although, Playa del Carmen is not too far from Cancun, being easy to go and come back faster then we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious "condo hotel" for the family”
Reviews.Author: DetTigerFan
Reviews.Content: This is a "better late than never" review for our stay at Maya Villa in February of 2011. I didn't realize my oversight until I sat down to start planning our 2012 trip! Our family of three (mom, dad and 12 yo son) spent a week at Maya Villa in February of 2011. We were in unit 417 which is one of the top floor 2-bedroom "penthouse" units. Our unit consisted of a large 2 br condo plus a huge private roof deck with hot tub, outdoor kitchen, shower and eating/lounge area above the unit. We had a fantastic view of the ocean from our deck. We were so comfortable during our week there -- I don't think we'll ever go back to "just" a hotel room ever again! First, location. This was the first time that we "settled" on a hotel that wasn't right "on the beach" but the fact is that our walk to the beach was no longer than most mega-resort rooms. It's a pleasant half-block down a quiet side street and only a couple of feet further than the El Taj "Beachside" units. We thought the nicest swimming beach to walk to was on the other side (east) of Constituyentes, maybe a 5-10 minute walk. The beach in front of El Taj is a 2-3 minute walk. The only thing to be aware of is that there is no elevator which might be unexpected for someone booking the "penthouse." The unit was furnished and outfitted impeccably. Nice linens, comfortable beds, well-outfitted kitchen. The kitchen was "pre-stocked" with basics like cold drinks, coffee, etc. at reasonable prices. We had a rental car and opted to do a full grocery run and had a lot of fun at Mega browsing through the Mexican products. We had been to Playa before and new that we would be picking up local seafood to cook and the grilled chicken (our absolute favorite). We loved having a fully equipped kitchen. We whipped up frozen cocktails with the blender and had our own happy hour in our hot tub on the roof deck.... really, it just doesn't get much better! There is no restaurant in the property but we didn't miss it. We had breakfast every morning at El Taj, right on the beach, which was included as a booking bonus. Set up as a continental buffet (breads, pastries, fruit, cold meats and cheeses, juice, etc.) plus your choice of a hot dish from a small but tasty menu. We also loved Era Ora, almost next door, for a casual pizza and Italian dishes. Maya Villa is a short walk from all the restaurants and nightlife on 5th ave. Actually, it's amazingly quiet considering how close it is! We booked our stay with the propery's management company and daily housekeeping was included. I don't know how this is handled for privately arranged reservations, such as through VRBO.com. Housekeeping was very good and surprisingly inobtrusive considering that the unit is so large. As much as we loved our stay at Maya Villa, we did experience some issues and they were all to do with maintenance. First, Playa seems to be one huge construction zone and we were aware before our visit that there was construction going on next door. We were told, however, that the exterior was complete and that it would just be "quiet" interior finishing work. Well, it wasn't quiet. We were OK with it during the day but the jackhammering right on the other side of the living room well into the evening got annoying, especially by day 3 or so, and we finally complained. It got marginally better and ended earlier in the day and we were also given a price adjustment. Customer service by the management was responsive. We also had some strange issues with the lighting/electricity. Some of the overhead lights began to flicker like strobe lights... and then the bedroom lights wouldn't turn off, at all... we solved it by systematically removing the light bulbs. Construction issues, I assume. Then our hot tub started to really, really smell and it took them an entire 24 hours to have it cleaned. The gas grill never really worked the whole week which put a damper on the grilled seafood dinner we'd planned on the deck. So, small annoying things that didn't bother us all that much except that we were paying high enough rates to expect that they wouldn't happen... All in all, a great stay, even with the small inconveniences. I think the "condo-hotel" is a FANTASTIC solution for families who want to really experience Playa without the "all-inclusive" trappings (which, frankly, I don't like) but still want all the comforts of home and the pampering of being on vacation. We had plenty of space to spread out, have some privacy for the adults and we could enjoy having drinks and a hot tub under the stars... We're hooked.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous & so close to the hot spots”
Reviews.Author: txkc
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better room or location. We were in a 3 bedroom penthouse suite, which was the perfect size for up to 6 adults. The suite was gorgeous with comfortable furnishings. The jacuzzi on the rooftop deck was great after our long nights out. The front desk was very informative and gave us the location of the closest grocery and we utilized the kitchen and grill without any issues. We were able to save money for a few meals without being inconvenienced. The kitchen had everything needed to prepare and serve our meals. We were one block from the ocean with free access to their sister property's beach club, which included comfy chairs or beds, towels, umbrellas and attentive waitstaff. Great complementary sunglass cleaning service as well. We were only a few blocks from what we found to be the most popular dance clubs in the area on 10 Nte and a block from access to the "main drag" on 5th Ave. If going back to Playa, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: Brandon Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early august. Tonight is actually our last night. THe room is absolutely amazing. Everything is modern and clean. There is ample living space, a free water cooler in the room, full kitchen etc. The pool is small but really nice and was perfect for our needs. We took a quick swim everyday and loved it. The best part is the location though. It is only a block from 5th ave and a block from the beach. Really no complaints here. We have traveled the Caribbean pretty extensively so I do have some experience in this, and this place is top notch at a very reasonable price. Our bell boy Daniel that showed us the room was also very helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking, quiet, walking distance to everywhere, but some cons too.”
Reviews.Author: brianakq
Reviews.Content: We were very happy upon first glance of our one bedroom condo, unit 412. The pool was small but beautiful with a nice size jacuzzi. The condo was spacious and had everything we needed. The location can't be beat as it is just outside of noise from the bars and close to 5th street, constitution, and the beach. You will have to walk a few blocks down the beach to get away from the boats though. The major problem we had was that the bed was extremely firm, this may be preferred by some but we were waking up with sore backs in need of massages. The prices seemed a bit high for the spa in the hotel but we were able to find a nice place down the street. Another issue we had that may be just a problem with this unit was that the AC seemed to have a mind of it's own. At times we would have the temperature set to 23.5 and it would be 20, other times we'd have it at 22 and it would be 24.5. They were offering 30% off at the time so overall I would say this was an okay value, if you like a firm bed this is the place for you, don't pay full price as it seems they offer some deal 20-50% off all year round. They setup a trip to the beach at Al Cielo for us about 20 minutes south and it was the spitting image of a Corona commercial.

Reviews.Title: “Really great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: NYC-TRAV-FAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 411 for 4 nights, initially booking Maya Villa over El Taj because it was cheaper and looked like it would be quieter. We also booked it because we planned to be out at the beach most of the time and didnt want to spend alot of $$ on our room. We were So pleasantly surprised!!! We loved our room, it had a complete kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and conveniently there is an enormous Walmart-like supermarket/super-store about 10minutes walk away, so we were able to buy groceries cook our own breakfasts. There is free drinking water in the rooms which is GREAT. we were expecting something very basic since the rate was so cheap, we felt like we were getting an amazing deal! The pool is great and would be also fun for kids, it's a fun/unique long and narrow shape which winds to a waterfall at one end and spa pool at the other end. We only used it once, it was always quiet, and either empty or with one or 2 people in it. There was also a guard or security at the front entrance to Maya Villa at all times, so it felt very safe. The location is FANTASTIC. on a very cute and QUIET street, we had no idea and were SO glad to have been lucky on a quiet street. one block either way is packed with restaurants and lively shops. The whole area was so charming and unexpectedly fun for us, really amazing food so close by. At check-in you are provided with a very good list of places to eat, concierge was also very helpful. The Monkey Cave was our fave restaurant. We also spent a day at the Al Cielo beach club at Xpu-ha beach which the concierge booked for us, it was gorgeous out there, and an incredibly beautiful beach, definitely a must and only a quick 20-min cab ride away! just be sure to bring your own beach towels if you go there... otherwise Guests at Maya Villa have free access to the beach and deck chairs nearby in front of El Taj which we enjoyed, though the ocean there was not as nice as Xpu-ha beach. We booked transportation through the hotel website for a car to and from the airport, and it was very nice to have someone waiting for us at the airport, but when we go back next time we'll just take a taxi as that seemed just as convenient and much cheaper. Once you're at Maya Villa you really dont need a car as everything is walking distance or there are taxis waiting around the corner... We thought the service was very good, we had a great time and would definitely recommend/go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condos!”
Reviews.Author: Hildent
Reviews.Content: The hotel consist of spaceous condos, and ours was really nice. Its fully equipped, daily maid service etc. We had a Penthouse and the roof was great with a spectacular view, bbq grill, jacuzzi etc. Just a 1 minute walk to the nice gym, and a 3 minutes walk to the beach. The photos from their website is very accurate. The pool is not too nice, its very small. The grill was covered with aluminium foile, and they told us not to take it off when griling. This was actualy very dangerous, because when liting it, the gas almost blew up in our face! Be aware off this and do not use it if all covered in aluminium foile, especially if children are around. It did rain a lot while we were there, and we had a leek from the roof in one of the bathrooms. We reported it and they tried to fix it by putting towels somewhere up there. Of course it didnt help, we reported it again, and they said they couldent fix it. We was promised another condo, and hours later the same night I went to the reseption too see what was going on. Seemed like they were not doing so much to sort it out, but after a while I was offered a condo in the Porto Playa complex. i asked to see the condo before moving, and it turned out, like I thought, it did not at all have the same view as the one we already had. The receptionist tried to chitchat and cut me off with that condo, but I said it was not acceptable. I found him to be quite arrogant, but After some discussion he apologized and said he could not do anything because the managers were on vacation and that he could get fired for giving us a new condo. I find it hard to believe all this, but I decided to wait until next morning (this was a sunday) and talk to the other receptionist. I asked for free WIFI as a compensation for the trouble and he agreed and gave me free acsess for the rest of our stay. Next morning I called the reception and talked to the woman this time, she was very helpful, instantley got us settled in a new Condo in El Taj, wich was an upgrade. She had people helping us move and get settled in the new condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wuilo
Reviews.Content: In February my son got married in Playa del Carmen and family and friends stayed at El Taj, Porto Playa and Villa Maya. We were so impressed with the room product, service, and the friendliness of the employees that when we decided to return to Playa del Carmen with avoided the usual main branded hotels outside of Playa. These Condominium Hotel have all the amenities of a five stars hotel and more. We are staying for more than three weeks so the kitchen appliances, laundry and dryer and a real coffee brewing machine are fantastic features that make our stay like a second home. We used to spend on average 50 US Dollars in taxis from the hotel to Playa every day (the alternative was to stay lacked up at the resort) By staying that El Taj or Maya Villa you are literally in the heart of the city, with walking distance to the action (if you are here to party) or secluded enough to read a book and watch the sunset. We enjoy walking to the beach or to our favorite restaurant. My favorite thing is to buy a real French Baguette at Chez Celine, a bottle of Mexican Wine at La Cava, some great cheese and enjoy it in my balcony before my siesta. (try doing that in a hotel) Housekeeping is amazing, the ladies are incredible they watch every detail and make you feel right at home. All the furniture and appliances are first class and are kept in great shape. We will never stay in a hotel when visiting Playa del Carmen, this alternative is just a great value. We love it!! If you are coming to Playa, I encorage you to check El Taj, Porto Playa and Villa Maya Condo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME place!”
Reviews.Author: maverickdog
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation to Playa Del Carmen yesterday and I had to immediately sit down and write a review of Maya Villa. We were there for 4 nights and the property completely exceeded our expectations. We stayed in room 408 (a 3br/3ba with a rooftop deck overlooking the ocean). Despite the fact that Maya Villa is a block away from the beach, we had great views of the beach and the ocean. A small sampling of what we liked best about Maya Villa: Cleanliness- the place was new and modern, great design, and spic and span. The cleaning service comes every day and does a great job. Location- we were worried we were going to be too far from the beach, but it turned out our location was perfect. It is an extremely short (90 second) walk down to the beach, and you are right around the corner from 5th avenue. It really was the best of both worlds. By the way, I had read one review mentioning construction and/or 5th avenue noise, we didn't hear any noise at all. Staff- they were quick, friendly, efficient, and responsive. The front desk is always manned, and there was a security officer out front every night all night. Pool and hot tub- we all loved the pool at the Maya Villa, very unique. Rooftop- probably our favorite part of the actual place. Had a wonderful view, an awesome lounge area, and a grill that we fired up a few times. Beach and Indigo Landing- the beach is right in front of El Taj (which also looks like an awesome place), and we had a great time there. Very nice attendants, comfy chairs, good services, 90 seconds away from the Maya Villa. Couldn't be beat. Yes there are some boats on the beach or in the water, but they are small fishing boats and frankly added to the vibe. We had no problem swimming in the ocean just by walking a hundred yards down the beach. Finally, I know this is long, but we went during a unlucky timeframe and had two straight days of torrential rain. Yeah, our trip surely would have been better if we had more sun, but it was the Maya Villa that saved our vacation. We had space to relax, the pool and hot tub to sit in during rain, and it was so close to 5th avenue we were able to stroll during periods of light rain up and down doing some shopping and bar hopping. We loved this place and are already planning on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!! Best vacay EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: julz123
Reviews.Content: We LOVED Maya Villa! We had Condo #406 which was a 2 BR 2 BA penthouse with roof top hot tub and palapa. This place was pristine clean and the all the staff were VERY friendly and helpful! There was always a guard posted out front 24/7. This place is a BEAUTIFUL oasis and not to be missed! Indigo Beach club was AWESOME too! The staff there was GREAT and worked VERY hard to make sure everyone was happy! They brought umbrellas and set up and were very quick to do ANYTHING you asked with no problems! I was SUPER impressed with the service there! CONS: The rooftop hot tubs are NOT connected to your room and as a previous poster stated..we were NOT told this so we could not enjoy it near as much as we would have liked because we were not comfortable leaving our 9 YO alone in the room. The window in our sons room did not lock and I reported this but nothing was ever done. There was no TV in one of the BR as was stated on the listing and there was no ironing board. All in all a GREAT stay and we will defnitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: waytogo400
Reviews.Content: We extended our stay because the folks at condo hotel properties are so nice and playa is an awesome place. We also stayed at their other property El Taj oceanfront but they were sold out for the extra days. We stayed two nights in Maya Villa and highly recommend Maya Villa if you like a small quaint luxury hotel. They have 4 properties but this one in particular is the most unique and very private and quiet. The condos are lavishly decorated with amazing details. The best part it includes their own beach club which is a short block away and fitness club. The pool at Mayavilla is the most unique pool we ever saw...it's more like a river pool that is shaped like a gecko. Fifth ave and all the clubs are just one block away and yet it is sooooo quiet inside this oasis. we highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Depends on Expectations”
Reviews.Author: hoopsover
Reviews.Content: The condo is well designed and very comfortable. Service has been slow although the manager was attentive and did address the issue of construction noise which is significant and right next door. You are also in the middle of night life city. Although the condo room we stayed in was out of ear shot of the very loud and annoying music of the night life scene, the other condo hotels in the same chain cannot make that claim. When you pay 350 us dollars per night and breakfast and internet are not included it would be nice if service was attentive. It is not. We are staying here now and are still waiting to get someone to help us figure out the dvd system after one hour. Two calls later and they are still not here. It is somewhat frustrating considering there are other places in this area that include all meals and good service for less. Think hard before you put down your money. The condos are nice but most apt do not have ocean views. The service is less than good, the manager was a nice person and concerned but all in all not very good value. If you are here with friends and family I would have a bit of a different perspective and this would be very good for something like that. It is not for couples looking for a romantic spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Cherie017
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at Sacbe which is a sister property down the street. Due to construction at a building beside Sacbe the jacuzzi and rooftop deck was not working so they offered us a discount. Then our air conditioning quit working so they moved to us to Maya Villa. We did not receive a room with a private rooftop jacuzzi but we loved the layout of Maya Villa and the public swimming pool and jacuzzi were beautiful. Everyone at this organization is extremely helpful and care about ensuring that your needs are taken care of. We will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: TerriLew
Reviews.Content: In April of 2010 my husband and I came to Maya Villa for our nieces wedding, and this was the condo they had selected to stay at, so we joined them at the same condo. What really sticks in my memory was the fact that I forgot my purse in our room when checking out last year (with valuables in it). The staff at Maya Villa made sure the purse was returned to me promptly (with all of it's contents). I can feel comfortable at these condos due to their trustworthy staff, personal attention, security services, and very friendly/helpful staff. Because of this, we returned in April of 2011. The room has everything you need (and more). Very spacious and clean kitchen. Nice size bedrooms. Very pleasant housekeepers and friendly security staff who greet you with a smile everytime you walk through. Very short walking distance to the beach. Penthouse condo has grill and wonderful spacious lounging area (with private hot tub). Walmart and Mega Foods are within walking distance (if you're use to walking a short distance). We bought food and grilled out on the rooftop a few times. We had some memorable bonding time on the rooftop as we watched the sunset. The only thing that could have been better is the bathroom vanity light could be brighter for women trying to put on makeup. We really enjoyed the new fitness center this year! Complete line of equipment to keep toned and fit. Very nice equipment and multiples of each so you normally get the equipment you'd like to use. I would definitely recommend this condo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best time and best service”
Reviews.Author: roly2000
Reviews.Content: Staying at Maya Villa was like discovering a hidden gem surrounded by tropical greenery, glistening gecko pools and water fountains. The spacious condo that the four of us shared had a large living room, private bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen and our own private terrace, located right next to an outdoor Jacuzzi. While it was our first time staying at a condo-style hotel, we are now wondering why would anyone even want to stay at one small hotel room, if you can get your whole condo suite for the same price, with excellent hotel services, including daily maid, 24-hour security, concierge and parking. There is a Spa on the ground floor, and a top-notch sports club across the street, which we had a complimentary access to. Beautiful white sand beach and Beach Club are two steps away, and 5th Avenue with all the entertainment and restaurants is right next to it. You cannot find a better deal in Playa del Carmen than Maya Villa, especially if you are traveling with a group of friends or a family.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation we have had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: graybonzo
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to Playa and by far the best The employees looked after us like we were there children. Everyone was polite and very attentive to any of our needs, The addition of the Indigo Beach Club perfected our stay with Condo Hotels. We were in Maya Villa which is only a 2 minute walk to Indigo. The beach and the accomodations at Indigo arer superb. The Italian run restaurant was wonderful and we enjoyed daily meals there with fabulous service from the staff. We wanted to adopt some of them. We have have been world travelers for quite a few years and can honestly say that this was one of our most memorable vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse units not safe for young children”
Reviews.Author: BevoDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: Our family recently rented a penthouse unit at Maya Villa (unit 413). The furniture is nice yet the penthouse layout is not safe for young children and the pool is not really usable, especially for children due to its depth. Our main issue is that the unit is vertical with three floors and one side is an interior large winging exposed staircase. We raised our concerns to building management and they recommended that we hold our children in our arms all week to prevent them from falling three flights of stairs while inside the unit. We elected to not stay in the unit and moved out to a house instead.

Reviews.Title: “Candid Review, Lovely Stay: A-”
Reviews.Author: lizi01
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 month old daughter and I stayed at The Maya Villa the last week of February. We were in unit 406 - a 2 bedroom/ 2 bath penthouse with private rooftop deck that included a jacuzzi, gas grill, fridge and outdoor living room. It was lovely. Pros: - Beautiful, first class accomodations - stainless steel appliances, marble floors, bathrooms, vessel sinks, nice sheets, nice crib for the baby, excellent cleaning service - Rooftop deck - My husband and I could put the baby down for a nap and then grab the baby monitor and head upstairs to grill and hang out. I could tan while my husband napped. It was great. - Location, location, location - 1 block from 5th avenue where all the hustle and bustle is and 1 block from the beach. It was so quiet but still in the middle of everything. - Great service - the concierge offers DVDs you can borrow (including Elmo!), was always very attentive to any of our requests - Private Beach Club about 20 - 30 minutes away - as a perk of staying there you have access to Al Cielo Beach Club which is located down a dirt road in Xphu-Ha. This is absolutely one of the most amazing beaches I have ever seen. You have to make a reservation through the concierge because there are only about 8 palapas. It is a $20USD cab ride each way but completely worth it. It is really breathtaking. We ate at the restaurant there and had our most amazing meal of the trip - the seafood paella. It only costs $100 Pesos to rent a palapa (about $8USD). Highly recommend you do this while you are there. Cons: - The El Taj beach is not that nice. While we never had a problem finding chairs, the beach directly in front of El Taj has fishing boats in it and is dirty with gasoline. You have to walk down the beach to be in clean water. - Our remote didn't work and they couldn't fix it, but did offer us 3 free days of wifi in our condo so we were happy. The wifi is $10USD/ day but with it you also have unlimited free international calls. - Stairs - We were in the penthouse units which was the 3rd floor but keep in mind there is not an elevator. There r only 17 units in the whole property which is awesome. The bellboys take your luggage up and we were fine with it - but if you have trouble walking up the stairs, this could be an issue. Overall we really had an amazing time. My husband and I have been all over the world together and never to the same place twice but we have already talked about going back. Our vacation was really the best one we have had as a family yet! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Worked Beautifully for All”
Reviews.Author: FatherOfTheBride9
Reviews.Content: Walk out of your room, through open air arcade with great organic wood art/furnishings, past pool and restaurant to Caribbean beach. If it's mornng, stop at tables on sand for the great breakfast buffet, then consider scuba, fishing, parasailing, just plain beaching. Boats for hire line beachfront (good perch for pelicans) and there's a sandbar just offshore, so best to walk a hundred yards down beach to open swimming area complete with lifeguard. No waiting for lounges on sand or in shade, there are plenty. Massages available, or name-designer golf courses down the road. Or Mayan ruins, down road and in jungle. Two blocks away from the beachfront buildng are the shops, restaurants (some are excellent), lounges of a lively small town that jumps at night. Rooms are clean, quiet, private, well-appointed and shower is great. So wife is happy (critical!!), kids busy, everyone has somewhere nearby they want to go at night. You could taxi to Cancun for more clubbing, shopping, dining, but why? We were a party of six, there to seek site for a wedding, and everyone had a great time. No facilities for large business meeting, 'though. Yes!! Not perfect, nothing is, but a very easy place to be, and to enjoy being. Worked very well for us, might work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: Ldub_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a large group of family and friends for 6 days at the Maya Villa Condo Hotel. We had an amazing experience! The facilities are beautiful and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. The staff was always available to answer any questions, and made our stay a relaxing and wonderful experience. And the hotel could not be more beautiful - our rooms were clean and spacious with gorgeous views! All in all a wonderful experience! And the surrounding neighborhood has wonderful restaurants, shopping and nightlife!

Reviews.Title: “a spectacular time,1/2 block to beach & gym & walk to dinner& night life!”
Reviews.Author: snowwy1
Reviews.Content: This incredible penthouse# 408 @ Playa del Carmen with 3 b/rooms, several decks & views of the ocean has it all for our week of pampering , workouts & fun, exceptional dining spots , great shopping. Massages on the beach or at the spa does it all...truly a walk to & through charming town. made for an incredible time!

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: skibreaz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Playa at Maya Villa. What a cozy, beautiful place. Stayed in a fabulous 3-bedroom, 3-level penthouse condo which was perfect for 4 women looking for a relaxing vacation spot. We were probably in one of the best units there-# 408--lots of space to move around in! With several outdoor patios to choose from. the private rooftop became our "hang". With a hot tub, outdoor grill, outdoor shower and a wonderful ocean view, it was the perfect way to start and end our day. Of course, we had to take advantage of the great gym , the private beach club , the fabulous array of international restaurants and shops....all within a 5 minute walk. I am already thinking of when I can get back there....next time with my husband and our extended family!

Reviews.Title: “At Maya Villa you can find your "home" away from home”
Reviews.Author: barbarabit
Reviews.Content: Maya Villa Condo Hotel is located within a few steps from its beautiful white sand private beach and the gym,which is the best one in Playa del Carmen. The private beach offers you its own restaurant,the food is delicious and the service is impeccable The appartments offer you everything you need and much more,the service is excellent and the staff is very helpful. There are different type of accomodations,including suites. On the ground floor there's a spa. Fine restaurants and the shopping area are just round the corner. It's a very peaceful place to rest and relax after a long day in the sun...I have been there twice and I'm planning to visit once again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: InSearchofSun247
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Playa del Carmen was about discovering the town AND Maya Villa. Without mentioning other Mexican resort towns or hotels, it's safe to say that our experience on this trip will make future travel decisions to Mexico easy. The town of Playa is safe, clean and unless you feel the need to explore the Aztec ruins or Geo Parks, completely walkable from almost any point. 5 Ave is pedestrian-only and lined with places to eat, drink, party, stay out late or simply stroll and people watch. We were very pleasantly surprised and are already planning a trip back with our kids. 2 short city blocks away is the beach. Flat, firm and easy to walk, the beach stretches for miles and the water is relatively calm for all ages. We encountered very few vendors and were only approached once or twice a day by someone selling their wares. Situated between the beach and 5 Ave is the perfect location of Maya Villa. Quiet, comfortable and safe it offers a retreat from the activity of the beach and the party crowd on 5 Ave....yet both are so close if you want either. Maya Villa is part of a 4 building condo group and has access to the facilities in each. One of the other condos is directly on the beach, so Maya Villa renters can use the beach chaises, umbrellas and the beach-side cafe with food & beverage service delivered directly to your chaise. Table service on-the-sand is available as well. A third condo building in the group has a fitness center on par with with some of the best. Spin classes, weights, treadmills, yoga in studio and on the beach are available as well. Maya Villa unit 408 is a 3 bedroom property that occupies the top 2 floors of the 4 story building. 2 bedrooms on the lower level and the 3rd bedroom and living areas upstairs. a cover deck and access to the roof is part of the property. The roof has a hot tub, outside shower, stainless BBQ and a great area to sit around and get crazy. Clear views of the Gulf add to a fantastic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation in every way.”
Reviews.Author: cfgs411
Reviews.Content: Maya Villa was terrific. It is a small, private complex. Location is great - right around the corner from 5th Ave. and 1/2 block from the beach. We stayed in Unit #408 - a 3 BR, 3 BA penthouse. It was decorated beautifully - right out of a magazine. We especially loved the private rooftop with a hot tub and outdoor shower and view of the ocean! (also a gas grill there). Enjoyed every minute of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I Couldn't Ask for a Better Location!”
Reviews.Author: SkiQueen007
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were blown away with this condo. What a fantastic location. Just a 3 minute walk to the beach, where a you are treated to a beach club with fabulous food, drinks, service, lounge COUCHES, and clean bathrooms. Walk another 3 minutes in the other direction and you are at 5th Avenue, complete with fantastic European Cuisine, excellent shopping and nightlife. Just 2 minute walk away is a world class fitness club where I took my first spin class in Spanish! This particular condo, #408, is the top floor. It has gorgeous views of the ocean and Cuzumel from its very private top deck. The top deck has it's own hot tub, bbq & Palapa. The decor is clean, contemporary, eclectic and funky cool. The condo is spotless and has all the comforts to make your trip effortless. The beds were comfortable, sheets soft, bathrooms beautiful. I would come back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodations in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: stratmandave
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended by a friend. At first we were skeptical but were pleasantly surprised. We had been to Cancun before and, although the beach was great, we didn't really like the general atmosphere of crazed youth in ultimate party mode. Playa del Carmen is much more subdued than Cancun. There are clubs to be sure but they are all in one small area and you can avoid them quite easily if you want. Access to the sites of the jungle is very easy from Playa. There are many places suitable for good family fun within 10 minutes of downtown. We went to a place called Xplor that had caverns, Zip lines, swimming, rafting, 4 wheeling and a fantastic buffet, all for one reasonable price. Now for the condo. It is a nearly new facility and is maintained very well. The architecture is reminiscent of Gaudi's work in Barcelona; very striking but functional at the same time. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is just perfect. It's on a quiet street but within just a few blocks of the main shopping and restaurant district i.e. Fifth Avenue. The restaurant selection is amazing and we didn't have a single bad dining experience even when we left the main area looking for authentic Mexican fare. Going in the other direction just one block is the beach, with it's clean, white powdery sand and dazzling azure water. Like I said, a perfect location.

HotelInfo.Name: Maya Villa Condo Hotel & Beach Club
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida 1a Norte, entre Calle 14 y 16, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
